results.title: The Living desert
results.creator_credit: James Algar, Ben Sharpsteen and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: A photographic study of plant and animal life in the arid plain which stretches from Oregon to Mexico and from California to Texas. Includes scenes of a death struggle between a hawk and a rattlesnake, an encounter between a bobcat and wild pigs, the pursuit of a kangaroo rat and her babies by a Kingsnake, a contest between two male turtles for the favour of a female, the courtship dance of a pair of scorpions by moonlight, and a time-lapse sequence showing desert wild flowers coming into bloom. Narrated by Winston Hibler.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Algar, Ben Sharpsteen and Walt Disney Pictures

results.title: The Last house on the left
results.creator_credit: Wes Craven, Sean S. Cunningham and Sean S. Cunningham Films
results.brief_description: Historically significant horror film by Wes Craven, is a rape-revenge drama that is unflinching in its depiction of murder, rape, sadism and violence. Despite the poor acting and cheap production values “Last house on the left” has a visceral impact that imparts a sense of dread and loathing upon the viewer. This film, at once derided for its brutality and yet praised for its daring, soon became a cult classic and was consequently, highly influential upon future horror-genre filmmakers. Along with “The Night of the living dead” (Romero, 1968) this film heralded the golden age of horror, ushering in an era of ‘realistic’ depiction of brutality in the American heartland. Contains graphic images and some scenes may disturb.

results.title: Basket case
results.creator_credit: Frank Henenlotter, Edgar Levins and Analysis Films
results.brief_description: Hilarious, cult, low-budget, highly eccentric slasher horror flick from Frank Henenlotter is about two Siamese twins, reluctantly separated in adolescence by merciless doctors. Seeking revenge, the two (one a full bodied man, and the other a head in a basket) set up in a seedy New York hotel, where they encounter an array of fringe dwellers. Minimal and basic special effects do not detract from the gruesome fun of seeing a mutant, enraged head on the rampage. Followed by two sequels in the 1990s.

results.title: Biggie and Tupac
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Broomfield, Michele D'Acosta and Lafayette Films
results.brief_description: Flawed but intriguing documentary from Nick Broomfield, about the deaths of rival African American rappers, Tupac Shakur and Biggie Smalls. Tupac Shakur was born into an impoverished and fractured family life, but went on to become a hugely successful musician; Biggie Smalls came from less humble beginnings but was similarly successful in his field. Once close friends, these two became bitter rivals in a gang war between rappers and their entourages on the East and West coasts. By interviewing a slew of the pair’s contemporaries, including Biggie’s mother, Broomfield investigates the possibility that Death Records impresario Suge Knight murdered the two and that the LA police were complicit. Broomfield certainly stumbles where angels fear to tread, including a visit to prison to interview Knight, as well as filming some very agitated characters, presenting an ambivalent but fascinating portrait for the viewer to draw on.

results.title: Laputa castle in the sky = Tenkuu no Shiro Rapyuta
results.creator_credit: Hayao Miyazaki, Tatsumi Yamashita, Isao Takahata and Studio Ghibli
results.brief_description: Children’s themed anime about a young girl fleeing pirates and corrupted government officials, who pursue her for a magical necklace that she wears. Pazu is the young boy who catches Sheeta as she floats down from the sky, and accompanies her on perilous adventures. Both seek Laputa, Sheeta’s ancestral home and a place of boyhood dreaming for Pazu, an elaborate and alluring Hayao airborne castle. Containing the visual spectacular feast that was the hallmark of “Spirited away”, Miyazaki presents an exciting adventure film, fleshing out his preoccupation with feisty (and imperilled) children, aeronautics and otherworldliness.

results.title: Osama
results.creator_credit: Siddiq Barmak, Julia Fraser, Julie LeBrocquy, Barmak Film, Nihon Hoso Kyokai and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: At first what seems to be a documentary about the Taliban in Afghanistan soon becomes a deeply moving and personal portrait of the effects of this oppressive regime on a young girl and her widowed mother. Caught up in a demonstration by women protesting the right to work, the girl and her mother drenched by water cannon take refuge off the street with a young boy (who will again in the future come to their aid). The mother works at the local hospital but is soon unable to continue as the grip of the evil enforced by the Taliban intensifies and women without a man present are not even allowed on the street. Hungry and unable to work the mother disguises her daughter as a boy and, as a boy, she gains employment with a sympathetic shop owner. The girl, now “Osama”, is forcibly taken from the shop to be indoctrinated with other young boys into the extremist philosophy of the Taliban. Her true sex is soon discovered and her sorrowful plight leaves the viewer totally despairing. Immaculate in narrative construction and shot beautifully (even though in the most harsh of environments and subject matter) impressive first time director Barmak realises this bleak and upsetting story with an assured authority. The first feature film shot in Afghanistan after the fall of the Taliban. Based on a true story. Awards include winner of Golden Globe for Best Foreign Language Film and Special Mention at Cannes for the Camera d’Or.

results.title: The Homecoming
results.creator_credit: Peter Hall, Ely Landau, Ely Landau Organization and American Express Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “American Film Theater = The American Film Theatre Collection”.
Lauded and much admired adaptation of the caustic Harold Pinter play about three estranged brothers and their father. When one son - an accomplished university professor - visits from America with his wife, the family are reunited in their London home only to find that tension and malevolence simmers dangerously below their every interaction. As a study of male violence, family dysfunction, rage and suppressed emotion, Pinter’s screenplay shines even if the characters’ motivations are opaque, and their capacity for hatred, disturbing. Cast includes: Vivien Merchant, Terence Rigby, Paul Rogers, Cyril Cusack, Michael Jayston, and Ian Holm who is brilliant as the menacing pimp, Lenny.

results.title: A Decade under the influence
results.creator_credit: Ted Demme, Richard LaGravenese, Jerry Kupfer, Gini Reticker and Independent Film Channel
results.brief_description: The 1970s was a revolutionary time for cinema; coming off the domineering era of the studio system, a new breed of filmmakers emerged with their own agendas, styles and stories to tell. Men such as Coppola, Scorsese, Hopper, Bogdanovich, Friedkin, Pollack, Cassevetes and Altman, transformed the industry with their raw and un-compromising stories that revelled not in escapism, but in realism, tackling such issues as the Vietnam War, the sexual revolution and their generation’s disenchantment with the false ideals and corruptness of society. Using clips from an array of films, and a slew of interviews with key players from the time, this documentary presents a thorough (but by no means exhaustive) and entertaining overview of the period, ending with the introduction of the first blockbusters of the 1970s “Jaws” and “Star Wars”. Interviewees include Martin Scorsese, Francis Ford Coppola, William Friedkin, Sydney Pollack, Ellen Burstyn, Julie Christie, Robert Altman, Dennis Hopper, Paul Schrader, Pam Grier, Jon Voight and Bruce Dern.

results.title: Snapshot = Day after Halloween = Day before Halloween  [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Simon Wincer, Antony Ginnane, AIFC and William Fayman
results.brief_description: Sigrid Thornton stars in this dramatic thriller as Angela, a young hairdresser who has just split up with her boyfriend Daryl (Vincent Gil). Daryl is obsessed by Angela and can’t move on after their break-up and follows her around in his “Mr Whippy” van. Upon meeting the exotic and glamorous Madeline (Chantal Contouri) Angela gives up hairdressing to try out as a model in glamour photography. Her first shoot is a topless one and suddenly she becomes very popular - the quick fame and money is a case of too much too soon and her youth and inexperience lead Angela to be manipulated. Tensions also rise as she becomes victim to an anonymous stalker. With music by Brian May, two songs performed by Sherbet and shot on location in Melbourne, this is also a snapshot of the city in the late 1970s. Released in the United States as “The Day before Halloween”. Note: the quality of the transfer to DVD is low. Cast includes Denise Drysdale, Robert Bruning, Julia Blake, Hugh Keays-Byrne, Bob Brown.
results.title_for_label: Snapshot = Day after Halloween = Day before Halloween [DVD]
results.creator_credit_for_label: Simon Wincer, Antony Ginnane, AIFC and William Fayman
results.description: Sigrid Thornton stars in this dramatic thriller as Angela, a young hairdresser who has just split up with her boyfriend Daryl (Vincent Gil). Daryl is obsessed by Angela and can’t move on after their break-up and follows her around in his “Mr Whippy” van. Upon meeting the exotic and glamorous Madeline (Chantal Contouri) Angela gives up hairdressing to try out as a model in glamour photography. Her first shoot is a topless one and suddenly she becomes very popular - the quick fame and money is a case of too much too soon and her youth and inexperience lead Angela to be manipulated. Tensions also rise as she becomes victim to an anonymous stalker. With music by Brian May, two songs performed by Sherbet and shot on location in Melbourne, this is also a snapshot of the city in the late 1970s. Released in the United States as “The Day before Halloween”. Note: the quality of the transfer to DVD is low. Cast includes Denise Drysdale, Robert Bruning, Julia Blake, Hugh Keays-Byrne, Bob Brown.

results.title: The Hairy bird
results.creator_credit: Sarah Kernochan, Peter Newman, Ira Deutchman, Redeemable Features and Alliance Communications
results.brief_description: A fun romp set in 1960s middle-class white America, in a private girls’ school that is set to become co-educational. Odette is a new student and finds herself a fish-out-of-water until she embraces her new roommates and friends learning of the girls’ secret society - the D.A.R. (Daughters of American Ravioli) a reference to the cans of cold pasta they pilfer from the school kitchens via their secret attic dwelling. The girls go about ruining the imposed decision that they merge with the boys at St Ambrose by sabotaging the school dance and becoming politically active, much to the pleasure of the strict but approachable headmistress (Lynn Redgrave). At Miss Godard’s School for Girls this coming-of-age tale is full of sass and toe-tapping fun. Written and directed by Sarah Kernochan. Cast includes: Kirsten Dunst, Gaby Hoffman, Rachel Leigh Cook, Vincent Kartheiser, Monica Keena, Heather Matarazzo, and Merritt Wever.
